intro: Physandra halimocnemis, commonly known as the coastal physandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky coastal areas. Its leaves are leathery and have a distinctive, waxy texture that helps it retain moisture in its native habitat. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient and adaptable species.
